title: What's the difference between a 'research scientist', 'scientist', 'staff scientist', 'data scientist', and 'applied scientist'? - Quora
tags: Jobs and Careers in Data Science

response.answer_text: Research - College or at a top company like Google doing research. Not applied or real world. Applied - Real world Data scientist - Can do research or applied. Staff - never heard it used in this space. In the real world you’ll see terms like junior, senior and principal to denote experience and expertise.
